title: Update magazine cover page with user portrait and revised cover text

requirements.text: Add the user’s uploaded portrait photo to the magazine cover (first page) and style it to match the existing editorial cover aesthetic (soft edges/shadows, paper-like feel). The cover must remain readable and responsive in both single-page (mobile) and spread (desktop) layouts.

quotes: ok great now on the first page of the magazine attach my picture which i am gonna attach with this message

acceptanceCriteria: A new static image asset derived from the uploaded portrait is added under frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the cover page component.
The Cover page displays the portrait in a dedicated image block (not as a full-background image) with consistent spacing and typography relative to the current cover design.
On small screens (single-page mode), the portrait scales/crops without overflowing and text remains legible (no overlap).
On larger screens (spread mode), the portrait and cover typography remain balanced and aligned; no layout shifts during page flips.

requirements.text: Update the cover page text content while keeping the same font choices, typographic hierarchy, and overall layout style: change the top-left label from “Portfolio” to “SHIVANGI KUMAR'”; change the year label to read “2026 collection”; and update the three cover highlight lines so that “Brand Design” becomes “BTech Computer Science”, “Product Design” becomes “1st year”, and “Packaging” becomes “Banasthali Vidyapeeth”.

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/features/portfolio/pages/CoverPage.tsx reflects the exact string “SHIVANGI KUMAR'” in place of “Portfolio”.
The cover displays “2026 collection” exactly (including the word “collection”).

The cover includes the three requested updated lines: “BTech Computer Science”, “1st year”, and “Banasthali Vidyapeeth”, styled consistently with existing cover microtype (uppercase tracking, muted charcoal) and aligned cleanly in the cover layout.
No other portfolio pages’ copy is unintentionally changed.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not modify files listed in frontend.immutablePaths (use alternative components/paths if needed).
Keep the portfolio content client-side; do not add backend dependencies for the cover changes.
nonGoals: Adding new navigation behavior, new pages, or changing the page-flip animation.
Implementing authentication or user profile editing.
Editing other portfolio pages’ content beyond what is needed to keep cover styling consistent.
